text:
36.
CONFERENCE INFORMATION
REGISTRATION
All persons planning to attend the conference should notify Mr. Anthony
W. Zaitz, Department of English, South College, University of Massachusetts,
Amherst, Massachusetts, immediately.
The registration process will begin at 9:00 A.M. Friday, April 8 at
Skinner Auditorium, Campus, University of Massachusetts.
ROOMS
Dormitory facilities are available at Knowlton House, University Campus,
where lodging will be assigned.
MEALS
Two organized meals and a social hour are planned; A 11 get acquainted1*
luncheon Friday, April 8 at 12:30 P.M.; dinner meeting at the Lord Jeffrey Inn,
Friday, April 8 at 6:00 P.M. Tickets are $.90 and $3.00 respectively.. Reser¬
vations should be made for the luncheon and dinner with Mr. Anthony Zaitz, Univ¬
ersity of Massachusetts. A blank for this purpose appears on the next page.
The Social Hour will be from 4:00 - 6:00 P.M. at the Lord Jeffrey Inn on Friday,
April 8.
CONFERENCE COMMITTEE
NAEB Headquarters Staff: Dr. Harry J. Skornia, Executive Director
Harold Hill, Associate Director
Co-hosts, Joint Conference Committee: Dr. Harry M. Lyle, Massachusetts Board
of Educational Television
Professor W. Worcester Smith, Western Massachusetts
Educational Television Council, Inc.
Professor Anthony W. Zaitz, WMUA, University of
Massachusetts
